meanings.definition: Having a strong smell or taste; foul-smelling or foul-tasting.
meanings.sent1: The putid odor from the garbage can made me hold my nose.
meanings.sent2: The putid taste of the spoiled milk made me gag.
meanings.sent3: The putid smell in the old basement was so bad, it could wake the dead.
meanings.sent4: The putid stench of the rotten eggs filled the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The putid aroma of the decaying fish lingered in the air for hours.

meanings.definition: Lacking in interest or excitement; dull or boring.
meanings.sent1: The putid lecture on history put me to sleep within minutes.
meanings.sent2: The movie was so putid that I couldn't wait for it to end.
meanings.sent3: The putid story in the book was like watching paint dry.
meanings.sent4: The putid conversation at the party made me want to escape.
meanings.sent5: The putid presentation at work was a struggle to stay awake through.
